data.name: Newton's Method
data.description:
Instructions

You will recieve an input of the form "anxn+an−1xn−1+...+a2x2+a1x+a0", as well as a point x and your job is to return the value at which x converges, if any, as a result of Newton's Method, if the solution diverges, return None. You stop the iteration after 512 iterations. if your final solution is such that, |f(x)| ≤ 0.01, return your solution, otherwise, return None. input = "x^3-x^2+80x+1600", -9 output = -9.20191 If the roots are a specific value, there is no need to fromat 5 decimal places, but they should have at least 1 decimal, for example, input = "2x-3", 1 output = 1.5 input = "x^2+80x+1600", -10 output = -40.0 input = "", 2 output = None

Newton's Method

If your not familiar with calculus, Newton's method is an iterative process use to find the roots of a polynomial equation. The formula of which being,

xn+1 = xn − f(xn)⁄f′(xn)

More on Newton's Method here: https://calcworkshop.com/derivatives/newtons-method/


Tests

You will be given 6 simple tests, 50 fixed tests and 75 random test cases


Beta

Currently in Beta, please provide more feedback in discourse and sugestions. I also don't know how perfect my answers are so please verify with me the validity of some tests.

Enjoy ;)
